Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Ranatuerin-2PLx (R2PLx, natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; XXU; 1S=S, UCSS1a)
Sequence Information.Source: skin secretions, the pickerel frog,Rana palustris, North America
Sequence Information.Crucial residues: cysteine-bridged segment and cationincity within the loop domain in C-terminus are required for activity.

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of the peptide shows 92.8% similarity toRanatuerin-2PLa. GRAVY: 0.23; Mol Wt: 2920.502; Mol formula: C124H221N33O39S3.Structure: In 50% TFE, it is helical.Activity: Active against S. aureus NCTC 10788 (MIC 32 uM) and E. coli NCTC 10418 (MIC 32 uM). Inactive: C.albicans NCTC 1467 (MIC 256 uM), MRSA ATCC 12493 (MIC 256 uM), E.fecalis NCTC 12697 (MIC 128 uM), and P.aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC >512 uM).MOA:cancer: This peptide also inhibits the proliferation of several tumour cells, such as prostate cancer cell, PC-3, probably via apoptosis. Updated Jan2020; 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Chen X, Zhang L, Ma C, Zhang Y, Xi X, Wang L, Zhou M, Burrows JF, Chen T.2018
Literature Information.Title: A novel antimicrobial peptide, Ranatuerin-2PLx, showing therapeutic potential in inhibiting proliferation of cancer cells
